title: Linda Hamilton is stylish in black dress as she headlines Terminator: Dark Fate fan event in Mexico
text:
She's back as iconic action hero Sarah Connor and ready to take on a new breed of Terminators.

And on Sunday, Linda Hamilton was the star attraction at a fan event in Mexico for the upcoming action movie Terminator: Dark Fate.

The 63-year-old actress reunites with Arnold Schwarzenegger as the original Terminator in what's being called a direct sequel to 1991's Terminator 2: Judgment Day.

She's back: Linda Hamilton, 63, was the star attraction at a fan event in Mexico City on Sunday for the upcoming action movie Terminator: Dark Fate

Hamilton belied her action star status in a black dress with puffy shoulders and half sleeves.

Her short hair was softly styled across her forehead and she accessorized with pendant earrings.

In the absence of her co-star Schwarzenegger, she made do with a larger-than-life replica of the Rev-9, an advanced Terminator prototype played in the film by Gabriel Luna.

In the movie, which opens in theatres on November 1, Sarah Connor seeks to protect a young woman named Dani Ramos, played by Natalia Reyes, who has been targeted for termination and is being hunted by the Rev-9.

Stylish: Hamilton, who reprises her role as Sarah Connor in the movie opening November 1, belied her action star status in a black dress with puffy shoulders and half sleeves

Sci-fi: In the absence of her co-star Arnold Schwarzenegger, she made do with a larger-than-life replica of the Rev-9, an advanced Terminator prototype played in the film by Gabriel Luna

More to the story: The actress picks up her iconic character 28 years after she last played her in what's billed as a direct sequel to 1991's Terminator 2: Judgment Day

Reyes joined Hamilton at the fan event in Mexico City as did Mackenzie Davies, who plays a cyborg from the future who also wants to protect Dani, and Diego Boneta, who plays Dani's older brother Miguel.

Reyes, 32, who is from Columbia, chose a sheer pink blouse over a camisole top and a full-length tulle skirt with embroidered embellishments.

Canadian actress Davis, 32, wore a sleeveless white tasseled dress while Mexican actor Boneta, 28, paired a dark blue suit with an orange turtleneck.

Pivotal role: Colombian actress Natalia Reyes, 32, plays Dani Reyes in the action thriller, a young woman who has been targeted for termination and is being hunted by the Rev-9

Looking pretty: Reyes chose a sheer pink blouse over a camisole top and a full-length tulle skirt with embroidered embellishments for her appearance at the fan event

Supporting cast: Canadian actress Mackenzier Davis, 32, wore a sleeveless white tasseled dress while Mexican actor Diego Boneta, 28, paired a dark blue suit with an orange turtleneck

Hamilton, who was previously married to Terminator creator James Cameron, left Los Angeles several years ago and acknowledges it took a while for her to decide to come out of acting retirement to reprise a character she last played 28 years ago.

'It wasn’t the script but just the thought of returning to this whole, big thing again after living such a quiet, normal life for so long,' she explained in an interview published in The Sunday Post.

'Then there is the thought of being compared to yourself as you were back then. That’s not easy for anyone but in the end I knew I had to do it.'

Fan faves: Hamilton reunites with Schwarzenegger who, as the original Terminator, returns to join Sarah Connor in a fight for the future

Getting back in shape so she convincingly looked like she could take on a Terminator and win was, naturally, a hard thing to do at 63.

'I did military training, stunt training, scuba lessons, Spanish lessons,' she said. 'It was extremely hard. At one point I was in the desert in Texas sobbing because it was so hard to be fluid with those weapons.'

'They loaded me up with 35lbs of weapons and I said, ‘Forget firing the weapons, I can’t even get out of the car!' she joked. 'There were days when I felt like it was almost physically impossible to keep going but we did it.'

As for the anticipation and excitement of seeing her and Schwarzenegger back together on the big screen, Hamilton gets it.

'I don’t want to let our fans down or the franchise down and I don’t want to let the character down,' she told The Sunday Post.
